intro: Hesperis aprica var. isatidea, commonly known as the yellow horned poppy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe. It features showy, bright yellow flowers with a distinctive horn-shaped center, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soil in full sun. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
